intro: Koanophyllon galeanum, commonly known as the Texas milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the milkweed family (Asclepiadaceae) and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and birds. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Koanophyllon galeanum is also known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
